abstract: Federal Railroad Administration, in move to reduce railroad crossing accidents, plans partnership with Google that will send audio and visual alerts through driver navigation systems when motorists are approaching a crossing; number of rail crossing accidents rose by 9 percent in 2014, with 270 people dying in highway-rail collisions.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Railroad Administration is hoping its new measure to integrate grade-crossing locations into mapping technology will curb the recent increase in crashes and fatalities.

headline.main: Agency Taps Mapping Technology to Curb Rail Crossing Accidents
headline.print_headline: Agency Taps Mapping Technology to Curb Rail Crossing Accidents

snippet: The Federal Railroad Administration is hoping its new measure to integrate grade-crossing locations into mapping technology will curb the recent increase in crashes and fatalities.
